sources.data_found: Data USA (IPEDS) 2022: Computer Science degrees awarded: 117 Bachelor's, 127 Master's.

student_data.notes: Exact counts derived from Fall 2023 Institutional Research reports (College of Arts & Sciences -> Department of Computer Science). Undergrad enrollment is approx 597. Graduate enrollment (MS+PhD) is 153. PhD count estimated based on NSF Survey of Earned Doctorates (~6 CS PhDs awarded/year × 5.5 years duration = ~33 active PhDs). [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: Located in CS department facility (1 server x 4 cards).
Mentioned in CS facilities, count not specified.

gpu_resources.notes: Kent State University heavily relies on the Ohio Supercomputer Center (OSC) for large-scale GPU needs (Ascend/Pitzer clusters), rather than hosting large on-premise clusters. The local verified on-prem resources are minimal: 1) Central HPC: 2 GPU nodes with NVIDIA V100s (Assumed 2 GPUs/node = 4 total). 2) CS Dept: Legacy hardware (K40, Titan X). [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

compute_credits.description: Internal research computing usage is generally subsidized/free for faculty. External access via Ohio Supercomputer Center is also heavily subsidized for Ohio researchers.

analysis_notes: Data reflects strictly on-premise hardware owned by KSU. The university is a member of the Ohio Supercomputer Center (OSC), which provides access to A100/H100 clusters, but these are shared state resources and not listed as university-owned assets here.
